dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few cars scatter the parking lot. WE hear GRUNTS follow by the distinct sound of basketballs shredding net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty gymnasium except for a shirtless MIKE O'DONNELL, Mike stands feet BEYOND the 3 point line, grabs balls fro hopper and rapidly shoots, shoots, shoots. SWISH...SWISH...SWISH. This kid's automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's hair, a pompadour mullet a la `21 Jump Street' and short shorts circa 1989.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustached and curly haired COACH HARVEY, 40, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, O'Donnell, save some for the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sinks one last jumper, turns to the Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just warming up, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Harvey hands Mike a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First game of the season and the scouts are already lining up. You have half the season I know you're capable of, you can play anywhere you want, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the FITCH FALCONS basketball team jogs out fr the locker room followed by a PHOTOGRAPHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round up, Jock Straps! Picture time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Team assembles in the middle of the court. A PLAYER kneeling in front holds a sign, `FITCH FALCONS, 1989'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.   Ed's not here yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOM, 17, handsome, tall, long rat tail, scoffs-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?      He's the water boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you suck, Dom, but we're letting you in the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shoving match breaks out between Mike and Dom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Hey!     Knock it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Harvey pulls the Players apart just as the gym door burst open. ED FREEDMAN, 17, sporting a jacket over a WIZ costume, runs in, trips on his robe, gets up, peels his clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. I was locked in a life and death battle with the dark wizard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fall in, Freedman. Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed takes a spot next to Dom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE see Dom reach behind Ed, grab hold of his underwear...RRRRIIIPP...FLASH. And with the flash WE cut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Falcons run, pass and shoot on one end of the court. the opposite end, a TEAM in BLUE warms up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights dim. Cue MC Hammer's `Can't Touch This'. CHEERLEAD at center court perform the Hammer DANCE ROUTINE. PAN aro the gym, everybody's doing the Hammer dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed awkwardly tries to imitate Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach shakes his head in disgust and when the routine end

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Ladies, bring it in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Falcons swarm to the bench, take seats.     Ed hands to the Players, skips Dom, stops at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, I can't help you with the girls if you keep showing up places dressed like the Cookie Crisp guy. Okay? Dude, don't look now but I think Muffy Campanella is scopin' you hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed jerks around to blatantly stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile, pud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed flashes a goofy smile.   MUFFY mimes puking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL'S VOICE (o.s.) Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARLET, 17, an 80's beauty, stands at the end of the ben

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that stone cold fox? Oh, it's my girlfriend. (walks over) I'm glad you're here, Scar. This whole scout thing's got me wicked nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom dribbles past, smiles at Scarlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dedicating my first basket to you, Scarlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way you shoot that might be mid- season! (to Scarlet) Everything cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles nervously, lies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Everything's totally copacetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE                              SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally?                           Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REFEREE blows the whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Remember, Boys, winners get the girls. Losers please themselves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scarlet) Excellent. Gotta run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her cheek, starts off, turns back-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT: We hear nothing but see Mike's body deflate. H steps away from Scarlet towards center court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy and her friends mock Ed and laugh hysterically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think Muffy's in to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, in a daze walks right past Ed. Takes his place for jump ball. The Crowd stomps and cheers LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ref is about to toss the ball. Mike looks up at the stands, sees a crushed Scarlet heading for the exit. Mike torn. Play or go after her. He goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going!? O'Donnell!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scar!    Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, slumps against the wall.    Mike catches up to Mike leans in and kisses Scarlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opulent HOMES.   OCEAN views.   Luxury CARS.   Manicured

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of an alarm clock shatters the silence as WE se in on a large, MEDITERRANEAN STYLE HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE O'DONNELL, now 36, angrily slaps the alarm off...6 A He climbs out of bed, bones creaking, stiff, groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A showered, suited Mike stands before the mirror, knots a around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (UNINSPIRED) Today is going to be a good day.     I love my job. I am a lucky man. Who's lucky? Mike O'Donnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike yanks his tie straight up as if he were hanging hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED FREEDMAN, now 36, lies on a portable table in his boxe ACUPUNCTURE NEEDLES protrude from every inch of his body, neck and face...at least 5000 needles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOT, YOUNG ACUPUNCTURIST adds more to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you feel your Qi flowing freely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if its my Qi or internal bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters, shakes his head in amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed looks over, sees Mike watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. There's Mr. Sunshine. Fei Jing Acupuncture. It's all the rage. Makes you look five years younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed climbs slowly off the table, shuffles over, groaning i pain the entire way. He pours himself a shot of BROWN LIQ from a pitcher, throws the shot back and immediately SPIT all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls to Acupuncturist) What's this brown stuff again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhinoceros urine. Pure protein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delish! (to Mike) The girl has absolutely no clue what she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you letting her stick needles in you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's hot. But today's not about me. It's about you becoming the new regional sales manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better be. I've invested 18 years of my life in that miserable company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No negativity. Negativity's for the 800 pound fat lady who needs to be airlifted out of bed. You, Michael Shawn O'Donnell, are a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A winner doesn't have to crash at his best friend's house because he was kicked out of his own house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?! It doesn't get any better than this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back. My legs just went numb. Good luck today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed drags painfully back to the Acupuncturist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike wheels his Audi A4 below a nondescript, two level building. Sign reads, `Wyatt Pharmaceuticals'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHARMACEUTICAL DRUG POSTERS cover the walls.    Smiling f happy couples...little pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounding a conference table are Mike's colleagues...HO WOMEN, 20 to 35, in skimpy business suits, chatting away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits amongst them, the only male present. A glum loo on his face. WENDY, bubbly, ditsy, 22, leans over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mike. You deserve it. You're like a totally amazing salesman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Wendy. That like totally means so much to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER, 23, boss, strides through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, peeps. As you all know, today I'll be naming the new regional sales manager. What's it take to be an RSM? Leadership skills, a comprehensive knowledge of today's prescription pharmaceuticals and most importantly a dedicated soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike straightens his tie, buttons his suit jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All being said, congratulations- (Mike begins to rise) Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbfounded, Mike slumps back into his seat.    Wendy spr up out of hers, SCREAMING and BOUNCING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go out there and sell some drugs peeps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Women stream out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this to me? I've been a salesman here 18 years. Wendy's only been here 2 months!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, your sales are admittedly better but she has the college degree. What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can give me the promotion, Roger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have changed. I couldn't even hire you now with only a high school diploma. My hands are tied, bro-ski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike swallows his pride and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pulls into the empty parking lot, climbs out of his and into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hurries down the hall, opens a door, peeks his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike peers around...nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. A basketball sits in the middle of the floor. Mike enters, picks up the ball, begins dribbling...faster between his legs, around his back, up to the 3 point line

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hits a perfect jumper at the imaginary buzzer, smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's still got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike dashes for the bouncing ball, scoops it up, goes for reverse lay up, makes it but when he lands...he lands...CRACK...hard. Mike grabs his lower back, groans-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh.   That was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike limps out of the gym, wanders over to a wall covered PHOTOGRAPHS...Fitch basketball teams of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike searches the pictures until he finds it...the photo saw being taken earlier...the team of 1989. Ed mid howl f Dom's wedgy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares at the photograph...lost in time and thought. The smiling, confident image of his youth stares back at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALE VOICE (o.s.) You know someone in that picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike startles from his daydream, turns. A kind-faced, old JANITOR, stands behind him, mop in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Me.     I'm in the center there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Janitor leans in, takes a closer look at Young Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adolescence can be so cruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? (lost in the picture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had life by the balls in that picture. Everything was possible. Then a few minutes later, pffffft, all gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `For of all sad words of tongue and pen, the saddest are these: `It might have been...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be my epitaph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have regrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's it have to be that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it does, maybe it doesn't. Can't hurt to ask. You never know who's listening, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael wistfully eyes the old photo, looks back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What are you doing, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX, 15, messy hair and slight, and MAGGIE, 17 and awkwa pretty, appear at the other end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Guys.     I was just talking to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks back to the Janitor...GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Sorry I'm late. You ready to get some dinner then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way towards the door.    Mike limping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you limping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tweaked my back pumping iron. Really, really heavy iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Alex and Maggie sit before dinner.    Alex eats hea Maggie quietly pushes her food around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet your chompin' at the bit for hoop season to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me and the guys are running drills, scrimmaging, getting in shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy. Remember, it's not how big you are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -it's how big you play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father and Son touch fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about you, Mags?   What's new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got into Georgetown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did!?    That's fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a huge deal. That's a great university. I'm proud of you. (Maggie remains quiet) Am I missing something here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot of emotional stress right now. My friends are all going to different schools, I'm not even sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not stress. Wait `til you get out into the real world, get a crappy job, have some smarmy twerp- boss calling you bro-ski...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the promotion, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still waiting to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike forces a smile hiding his disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pulls up behind a `Dom's Nursery' van. He, Alex and Maggie step out. Mike eyes the van with disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your mom home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, next week we'll have a barbecue at Uncle Ed's. Sound good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm counting down the minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie heads straight for the modest ranch house and insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see you once a week for a couple hours. What do you expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex follows Maggie into the house.   Mike makes his way around back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mike rounds the corner, he almost runs into a smiling Johnson, 36. Don lugs 3 loaded trash bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike. Good to see you.    Tough break, you and Scarlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bite me, Dom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom serves Mike a cocky wink, continues on.    Mike scowl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet, 36, slams a shovel into the ground, wedges it beneath a dying shrub and rips it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little late for a delivery isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom was in the neighborhood. He offered to make a dump run for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't he live 30 miles from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. He's been after you since 10th grade and he's after you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least someone's after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles playfully and begins to serenade-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `In touch with the ground, I'm on the hunt I'm after you.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet shakes her head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mike. This isn't high school. That's not gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Smell like I sound, I'm lost in a crowd, and I'm hungry like the wolf.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike flirtatiously stalks her.   Scarlet fights smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop now. It's not working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Mouth is alive, with juices like wine, and I'm hungry like the wolf'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets close to Scarlet's face. She smiles, stops hers and pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You no longer have the right to invoke the "wolf."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chastised Mike eyes the yard...it's a WRECK...holes and mounds of dirt everywhere, carcasses of dead plants, bush and flowers strewn about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you destroying the yard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet stops shoveling, wipes dirt from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna use it as a showpiece for clients. Thanks for asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of a big undertaking isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a landscape designer. Then again you barely took an interest in my work so I guess that's a fair question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.   Then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. But maybe this is what you needed. Maybe it's time you looked for something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great idea, Scar. Because there are so many options out there for a 36 year old with only a high school diploma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet throws the shovel to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all my fault, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it's what you think, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's silence says it all.    Scarlet fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never asked you to marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet shakes her head in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you're not happy with the way your life turned out Mike, really, I am, but you're not the victim here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet goes back to shoveling.    Mike turns, steps, fal into a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A somber Mike drives alongside the Los Angeles River. An song plays low on the radio...static...then...BOOM. THUND roars scaring Mike and literally shaking the Audi. SPLASH RAIN drops in buckets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns the wipers on high. Not much help. He slows th car to a crawl, straining to see out the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING flashes. We see the Janitor leaning over the railing looking into the raging river. Mike brakes, throw his door open, jumps out into the pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!?     Get away from there!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, blinded by the rain makes his way to the railing. T Janitor's GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!!   Hello!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike leans over the rickety railing, looks down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phosphorescent water swirls angrily...rising quickly. It's mesmerizing. Magical. Mike can't take his eyes off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTENING FLASHES Mike's 17 year-old face reflection sta back up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK. The railing BREAKS.    Mike FALLS...SPLASH...headl into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's Audi rolls into the driveway. The door swings open A muddy, shoeless foot steps out followed by a shoed foot in no better shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE follow the feet, tattered slacks dragging on the cemen to the door. 2 filthy hands dig into pockets, searching-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. (pushes doorbell) Ed! Ed! I lost my key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, wrapped in a robe, tissue between his toes, wobbles t the door so as not to mess up his freshly polished nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming!   I've been worried sick! WHERE-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed opens the door...standing before him is Mike, covered MUD. His ripped, grimy suit now hangs off of him because...HE'S 17 AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's eyes widen with FEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a really rough night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAHHHHHHHHH!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed slams the door, frantically wobbles away. The door ope ANGLE ON the muddy feet as they enter and follow the trai cotton balls up the stairs and to the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Ed cowering against the back wall, brandishing a over-sized loofah. The door slowly swings open. Ed gasps-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come any closer!    I'll use it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? Exfoliate me to death? (Ed shrieks) You got into my samples case again, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whimpering Ed points to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem, it's only mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muddy feet turn toward the mirror and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON the mirror. Mike's 17. He turns on the water, splashes his face frantically. Mud gone. He's still 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike tears his suit jacket and shirt off...hairless chest He yanks off his pants, peeks down his boxers-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dreaming right? Is this some kind of hallucination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pulls Ed up by his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something! Anything!    Pinch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed throws a knee into Mike's nuts, bolts out the door SCREAMING. Mike crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said pinch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed reaches the door, fumbles with the locks. He just mana to open the door when Mike tackles him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two buddies roll around, limbs intertwined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
