dialogues.text: The Boys view the flashy, finished product, tap fists. page makes `Mark Freedman' look like a playboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SALESMAN hands a smiling Mike his new iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits on the bed, types away on his laptop. A knock o the door. Mike looks up and YELLS. Ed stands in the doorway, his entire body and head wrapped in SEAWEED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you ask, it's a seaweed wrap. I'm detoxifying as well as losing an inch or 2 from my problem areas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a very hot girl downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is.    What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forwarded my calls to my new phone, sent some work emails and just lobbed one to Scarlet, told her I was in Peru finding myself. Think she'll buy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not because when she called earlier I told her you were being detained at Guantanamo. Ready for tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed flips Mike a set of keys.     Mike's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ought'a put you over the top. And don't forget to hook me up son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed plods off.   Off Mike's huge smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual pre-school ritual. Stan, Jazz, Kevin, the Wonde Bras and Maggie all hang around Stan's `stang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Maggie wrapped in a heated embrace, kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONK.   A horn blares.    Stan and Maggie jump out of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ASTON MARTIN VANQUISH stops next to the crew. The tint window rolls down revealing the new and improved Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike winks then rolls on past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.     Was that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you he was cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the MOMENT.   Mike walks the hallway, handsome and h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, Lauren and Jamie text by their lockers.    Mike struts up to them. The Bras smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've been here a couple days now and I think I got it figured out. You girls are lesbians, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bras' jaws hit the floor. Mike walks off, a huge grin his face. Man, that felt good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps from the kitchen area carrying a TRAY, scans t crowded room, finds Alex seated at a table ALONE. It's a heartbreaking image. Mike approaches-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I sit here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark?    You look totally different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits across from Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got rid of the bull's eye on my forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you move to the left a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike inches left, peeks behind him...2 girls eat lunch together. The one facing them is a cute Latino, NICOLE, 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole smiles.    Alex quickly shies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole Lopez. She's in my Spanish class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you spoken to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I get all stupid so I just stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you a funny story. The first time I met your mother I was so nervous-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, `the first time I met your mother I was so nervous...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did?    That's weird.   Is your mom hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on tonight?    You wanna hang out? Do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you could show me around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wonder Bras sway in, take seats at the VIP table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll swing by your house around 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't go over there. Stan and his Baboons have lunch this period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike strolls over to the Bras' table, plunks himself down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you girls catch Ellen yesterday? Rosie was on. Melissa Etheridge jammed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -You're so rude!? We're not gay. We like boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Samantha's a total slu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last New Year's Samantha made it with my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on like 5 Red Bulls! I can't believe you keep bringing that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bras' begin to bicker amongst themselves. Mike pulls his new iPhone, plugs the earphones in his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bras immediately stop bickering, ogle the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rad phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'll text you...NOT. Later...much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rises from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like we'd ever give you our numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, carrying a basketball, his goons and Maggie come up behind Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan whips the ball at Mike. Mike, cat-quick, spins aroun catches the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole cafeteria turns their attention on Mike and Sta Mike points to the name `Stan' on Stan's letter jacket, r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan. Did mommy sew that on there so you wouldn't forget your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter from the Students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think `cause you got a haircut and new clothes people'd forget what a fag you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out, Stan.    Let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme my ball back, bee-yotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike ignores him and starts dribbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Stan, I feel sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike speaks loudly now, playing to the cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh but I do. All too well. You're the man. Captain of the basketball team. Dates the pretty girls. High school is your kingdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and his Posse tap fists. Mike dribbles between his l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, People, Stan's a bully. Why? It would be way too easy to say Stan preys on the weak because he's simply a dick. No, Stan's more complex than that. According to leading psychiatrists Stan is a bully for 1 of 3 reasons. 1, under all that male bravado there's an insecure little girl banging on the closet door trying to get out. 2, like a caveman, Stan's brain is underdeveloped. Therefore Stan is unable to use self-control so he acts out aggressively. And the third reason-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike holds up his pinky then spins the ball on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd argue that Stan suffers from all 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire cafeteria LAUGHS HYSTERICALLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike feigns whipping it back at Stan, who recoils, then gently rolls the ball back to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WINKS) Don't hurt yourself big boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some students, including Alex, ERUPT. The Wonder Bras eye Mike with new found lust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Mike's face as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) 3, 2, 1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike ducks just as the ball whizzes overhead, rockets acr the cafeteria landing on Miss Goodwin's tray, splattering with food. She glares at Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's iphone buzzes...ANGLE ON SCREEN: the Wonder Bras digits appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters, approaches MRS. MENCER, 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guidance councilor made me come, but just so you know I'm not planning on going to college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of kids feel that way. Don't be intimidated. It doesn't hurt to take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mencer hands Mike a hefty book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good place to start is here... this book has information on every college and university in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits, starts paging through the book and gets lost i the bright colored pictures...smiling STUDENTS, CAMPUSES LECTURE HALLS...THE OPTIONS HE LOST YEARS AGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pumped-up Mike dials...ringing. On the seat beside him rests a stack of college applications. Ed answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED (o.s.) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was incredible! I was incredible! You should'a seen me! I humiliated Stan in front of the entire lunchroom. Everyone was clapping. The popular girls were begging to give me their numbers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what happens when you put a little lipstick on the pig? Did you manage to get sent to the principal's office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I feel great! I even shot some hoops after school. No aches. No pains. Gotta run, Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aston Martin pulls up. Mike climbs out, walks to the door, takes a deep breath and rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARLET (o.s.) Coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens revealing Scarlet in her dirty yard attire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been dying to meet you. I've known your father since...(gasps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet...SPEECHLESS...visibly stunned by the resemblance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLUSTERED) No. It's just...you look like...No. I'm fine. Come in. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet and Mike sit across from one another. Scarlet sta at Mike as if examining every pore on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say Ed Freedman is your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my dad. All 68 inches of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look anything like him. If you don't mind me asking, who's your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother...she...she was...a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike spies Dostoevsky's Crime and Punishment on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -a convict. In New Jersey. They met while dad was at Princeton. She was on parole. B&E, fist fighting, shanking. Nothing major. But she's dead now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?   I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned her about kite surfing during hurricane season. So how are things with you? Doing anything exciting? Dating? Flirting with Dom Johnson maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you ask about Dom? Did Ed tell you to say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean do what you want. You're a grown woman but, word on the street is Dom's been spreading gingivitis all over town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet can't take her eyes off Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's crazy how much you like my husband when he was a teenager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike switches subjects, points to her dirty clothes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doing some gardening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm a landscape designer. I'm actually redoing the backyard. I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet stands, leads Mike to the french doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a work in progress so you'll have to use your imagination some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet opens the doors, flips on the lights. The yard's been cleaned up. Fresh blankets of sod rest in piles next stacks of limestone. HUNDREDS of unplanted plants, flower trees and shrubs sit around the yard in strategic positio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scarlet step outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost don't even recognize it...er...if I had seen it before I probably wouldn't recognize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have. It was a disaster back here a few days ago. Obviously I have a lot to do still. I'm laying the sod next and the limestone pathway will go here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet moves about the yard, pointing and explaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll plant all those, over a hundred different types of flowers and plants. I have an amazing fountain being delivered that'll go here and a bench over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll string rows of tiny, white lights above it all so every night will be a starry one. It'll be a real sanctuary back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems like a lot'a work for one person, Scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chill runs up Scarlet's spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband's the only one that ever calls me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex appears at the doors interrupting-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Mark.    Let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck with the project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. And, Alex, be home by 10:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike heads back inside.   Scarlet stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Alex step in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your mom doing? You know, with your dad not being around and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't like to show it but I know she's bummed. I think it bothers her more that he hasn't called me or Maggie in a while. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP. BEEP. Mike pulls out his iPhone, text message from Samantha. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wat^? mobinit 2 zuma. soi! but w/e. brb. bk. gtg. ttyl. xo. sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares at the screen as if it were in hieroglyphics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what this says?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex takes the phone from Mike, reads-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says `What up? Mobbing it to Zuma. So over it but whatever. Be right back. Back. Got to go. Talk to you later. kiss, hug. Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hit the beach, wingman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two touch fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BONFIRE illuminates the night sky. MUSIC plays. KIDS la on blankets, play football. Others splash in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE find Maggie and the Wonder Bras seated by the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on his myspace page. There's a picture of him jamming with the Chili Peppers at Coachella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard Timbaland wants to produce an album with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he turned him down to help orphans with Brangelina in Nambib-ib-bib...in Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!     I bet he knows Justin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Mike and a nervous Alex make their way down the sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks boring. Let's go back to my house and play video games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex turns.   Mike grabs his arm, turns him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you so nervous about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beach is for the older, cool kids. I don't belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You're a basketball player. You're cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't play basketball. I mean, I can play, I just don't play on the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you were getting ready for the season?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never told you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a confused Mike and Alex approach the scene, BOYS call to Mike, tap his fist. GIRLS fawn over him. Mike's become celebrity...and he's eating it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Lauren spots Mike with Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bras whip their heads around, get all dreamy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he be any lamer? Using my little brother to get to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that boy was an apple he'd be delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha leaps up, scurries over to Mike.      Lauren and chase after her. Maggie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mike and Alex approach the gathering, Alex freezes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man.   It's her.   She's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex nods towards the fire.   Seated with FRIENDS is Nico Alex BELCHES loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so pretty it makes me gassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Here's what you're gonna do. You're gonna go over there and introduce yourself-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't like me, Mark.   I'm a loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike grabs Alex by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because Stan says so? You think Stan's a winner? He's going nowhere. You're a great kid. Any girl would be lucky to get your attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. And right now, there's a girl over there who's dying to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A determined look comes over Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   What do I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just introduce yourself. Then compliment her on something she never gets complimented on. Like if she has big, meaty, man hands tell her she should be a hand model. (Alex burps nervously) And don't burp on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex takes a deep breath, marches off just as Samantha ru up and throws her arms around Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came! Why don't we take a walk somewhere private and play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and Lauren rush over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, Sam. Mark promised me a walk on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk with me. I've got less miles on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full blown ARGUMENT breaks out between the Bras.    Mik Maggie sitting by the fire alone, slips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Alex steps over to Nicole and suddenly loses confidence. As he turns to retreat, Nicole looks up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stops, turns back around and blurts out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Alex.     I'm Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole and her Friends giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like a Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have big, meaty man hands.    You should be a hand model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girls' jaws drop.    Nicole hides her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!     Seriously!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex rips a huge BURP.    The Girls duck for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he got some on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I'm sorry. I'm just real nervous and I've wanted to talk to you for so long. And Mark told me to compliment you on something you never get complimented on but I couldn't find anything because everything's so...perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole and her Friends MELT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to sit down, Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole scoots over making room next to her.    Alex smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Mike sits down beside Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan.   Why are you dating him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the point why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. He's not a nice guy. Matter of fact he's a jackass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about him like that. You don't even know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he bullies your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan barely knows Alex exists. We're moving in together after graduation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Whoa. Whoa. I thought you were going to Georgetown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Westwood Community College. Stan and I both are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike loses it, leaps to his feet shouting-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you are, Young Lady! If you think I'm gonna let you throw your life away on some Sleestack you're crazy! I forbid you to see him anymore and that's final!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie jumps up.   Kids all stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you are!?   My father?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie stomps over to the still bickering Bras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you walk away from me, Margaret Sarah O'Donnell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie and the Bras turn towards Mike and glare.   Maggie heads for the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Margaret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even know her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so not into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bras make the `text me' sign then hurry after Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike kicks angrily at the sand and accidentally into the faces of a group of KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOT GIRL wearing a `Lifeguard' bathing suit sits atop a high chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed floats on a raft. A frozen drink next to him.    Scarl looms over him, the 2 in a heated conversation-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't heard from him in three weeks. Obviously he doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps from the house, sees Scarlet-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Mark. I was just dropping something off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet tosses a manila envelope on the patio table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our court date is the 27th. If he has anything to say, he can say it then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That envelope contains divorce papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike eyes the envelope, in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what do you care? You're going to college, right? Life's one big panty raid for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike feigns innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the applications in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went through my room!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd cleaned like I asked I wouldn't have had to. You can't be serious about this can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike starts to argue then gives in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to face the possibility that I might never turn back and if that's the case, I'm going to do it right this time around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karmically speaking, in the next life you're coming back as a hemorrhoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike scoffs, storms off.    Ed calls after him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not paying for college!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shoves books in his locker.   Stan approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like her, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriend. She told me you were trashing me at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone, Stan.    She's a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how good she is yet but after I find out, she's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan walks off.   Mike slams his locker shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slips inside the empty classroom, slathers KRAZY GLU all over Stan's DESKTOP and CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits just as the rest of the class files in. Stan ki Maggie and takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan leans on his desk, placing a FOREARM and a HAND on t sticky desktop. He catches Mike looking back at him and gives him a cocky wink. Mike winks back knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's phone beeps. He checks it...A PIX MESSAGE...3 perf ASSES in tiny bikini bottoms. A wide-eyed Mike spins in h seat to find the Wonder Bras smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Adams enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle, people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adams scribbles a large equation on the blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was your homework. Who can come up here and solve this for me? Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blank, uninterested faces. Scattered giggles.   Adams tos the chalk angrily on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one person. Fine. Miss O'Donnell. Come up here and dazzle us with your brilliance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie rises nervously from her seat, shuffles to the fro of the class. As she passes Stan WE see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan lifts his fingers from the desktop...it's WET...he places his wet fingers to the tip of his nose and smells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Stan tries to remove his fingers from his nose...the STICK. Stan tries to raise his other arm...STUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuck!!!   I'm stuck!   My fingers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan stands, hunched...the CHAIR GLUED to his butt. The D ATTACHED to his forearm and his FINGERS STUCK to his nose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids and Mike burst out laughing, break out their vid phones as Stan fumbles around, dragging the desk, PANICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Stan! Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's glue! I'm glued to everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz bounds out of his seat, grabs hold of Stan's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!    No!   Don't pull--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RRRRIIIIPPPP.    Jazz yanks.   Stan's SCREAM echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, wearing basketball gear and bouncing a basketball, stands in the middle of the court. Alex enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your text.     What's so important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This year you're making the team. We practice everyday `til try outs. That gives us a week and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. You probably don't have any skills anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike begins to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!     I got skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your problem?      Is it Stan and his friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to be afraid of them, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too small anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we focus on your speed, dribbling and outside shot. Remember, it's not how big you are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -it's how big you play. (QUIZZICALLY) Where did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (COVERS) I don't know? Read it somewhere I guess. Be a sport. Show me what you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike tosses Alex the ball. Alex begins to dribble. Mike steps up to defend. Alex dribbles quicker, through his le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.   You got a little game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM. The doors slam open. In walk Stan and his Posse. BLOOD speckled BAND-AID covers the tip of Stan's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you 2 queers doing in my gym?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stops dribbling. He and Mike move towards the door. Stan and his Posse block the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. You girls wanna play with the boys then let's play. 2 on 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll save you the embarrassment for try-outs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan takes the ball from Alex, turns his back, dribbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ally. Embarrass me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While dribbling, Stan moves backwards, bumping into Alex' midsection, forcing Alex back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex takes a deep breath, tired of being afraid-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.     I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex throws his hands up, tries to defend the much bigger Stan. Stan easily backs Alex down, faking left and right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?     Here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan spins, elbows high...POW...Alex catches one to the h and DROPS. Stan shoots and scores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 points!     And I was fouled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan high 5's Jazz and Kevin. Blind with RAGE, Mike RUSHE Stan...WHAM...tackles him hard to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz and Kevin throw Mike off Stan, punching and kicking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH HARVEY, now 58, enters the gym, runs over to the fracas, pulls the boys apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! That's enough! That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and a nervous Alex sit outside the principal's offic Mike holds an ice pack to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom's been in there a while. She's gonna be pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Act like you're hurt and she won't be able to stay mad at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open.    An elated Ed blows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, slugger! Get any shots in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Freedman, your son has a black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed sits between Mike and Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Alex.     How you doin', buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good. (turns to Mike, nudges

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice goin'. How do I look? Anything in my teeth? How's my breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed flashes his pearly whites then blows on Mike. The principal's door opens, an angry Scarlet steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Scarlet. Exciting, isn't it? My first parent/principal conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet looks sternly to Alex-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting?     What's gotten into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs his jaw) I can't talk, Mom.     My jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MELTS) My poor baby. And how about you, Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet bends down so she's eye to eye with Mike.   She removes the ice pack...a purple shiner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.   You poor thing. Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet strokes Mike's face. Mike loses himself in her caring, gentle touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. You smell great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet, a bit weirded out by Mike, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, I'll meet you at the car.     I need to talk to Uncle Ed for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex shuffles out of the office.   Scarlet turns to Ed, h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you give him the divorce papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent them to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it another woman? I can handle it. Tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't heard from him, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet looks down, fights back tears, unravels a bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. If you do, please have him call home. For the kids...I'm running out of excuses-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him.    I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet forces a smile. Mike watches her go. For the firs time he's seen HER REALITY...hurt, pain, frustration. Mik places his head sadly in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie the Principal pokes her head out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed whispers to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ed passes Julie on the way in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm heartbroken. The boy's incorrigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed takes a seat across from Julie, puts on his best `trou parent' look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if it was only one isolated fight it wouldn't distress me all that much. Boys will be boys. But, it's also been brought to my attention that Mark may have Krazy glued a boy to his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed stifles a laugh, puts on a serious face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son?     Mark!   Get in here!   Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slouches in, takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you glue a boy to his chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed throws his hands up in exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? The boy's out of control. He's acting up at home. He won't eat his vegetables-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE                                 ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shaves his back.                He sucks his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE                                ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears girls underwear.          He wets his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Mark, I know it's hard to be the new kid but if I have anymore trouble from you, you'll be facing detentions or worse. You can go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods, exits.   Ed stands and with exaggerated sadnes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crying out for help and I don't know what to do. It hurts so bad. Maybe we could discuss this over margaritas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give him time to figure it out on his own. If the situation gets worse then we'll take the next step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the expert. I'm just a single dad out here blowing like dust in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed shakes Julie's hand and exits, sniffling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirt covered Scarlet wrestles a roll of sod down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE (o.s.) Got an extra pair of gloves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet peers over her shoulder...Mike wanders in.    Sca stands, wipes her bare, dirty hands on her jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloves are for sissies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I just had a manicure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) You're serious? You want to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I love landscaping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right up there with watching "Sex and the City" and snuggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet laughs, eyes him skeptically-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, I'm 36 years old-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just doing this to make a few bucks so I can buy Laker tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BLUSHES) Embarrassing. Sorry.      I'll give you 10 dollars a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. 10 whole dollars. At that rate I should be able to buy tickets in...2011.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   20.     Grab a roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scarlet, step over to the sod, lift a roll toget carry it over to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the benefits like here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll throw in a baloney sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scarlet share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike strolls in, sits at a back table, pulls a college application from his knapsack. He takes out a pen, places the tip to the paper where it says `name' when-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE hear the muffled sound of CRYING. Mike rises, follows sobs through the maze of stacks until he finds-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -seated on the floor, head hidden between her knees.   Ma looks up, sees Mike, quickly dries her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? To rub it in my face? Say I told you so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie drops her head back between her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan dumped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie BAWLS loudly.    Mike panics, fearing the worst-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? What did he do? You didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom was working last night. Stan came over with a box of-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slaps his palms over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your next word better be `cookies' or you're in big, big trouble!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do?    I can't live without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie takes Mike's shirt, BLOWS her nose on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, did you two...you know...do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing...that rabbits do a lot of and that a girl your age should never do and should only do when she's married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex?   No, that's why he dumped me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie bawls again. Mike silently celebrates, sits beside her, awkwardly pats her on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, there now.       It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he was a jerk but he was there for me. Which is more than I can say for any other man in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie sobs uncontrollably.      Mike takes a deep breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're young everything seems like the end of the world. But it's not. It's just the beginning. And you might have to meet a few more jerks, but one day you'll meet a boy who treats you the way you deserve to be treated...like the sun rises and sets with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie throws her arms around Mike, hugs him tight. Mike hugs her back. A moment he's never had with his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Maggie's face.       She's SMITTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex dribbles, using both hands, while running through a of cones. Whenever he messes up, Mike makes him start aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scarlet settle the limestone rocks into the fres laid sod creating a walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie solves a difficult problem on the board, much to M Adam's chagrin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie turns from the chalkboard and smiles flirtatiously Mike. Stan catches this exchange and pops the back of Mik head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights shine down. Alex stands behind the 3 point line. Mike feeds him balls. Alex shoots and moves. Shoots and moves. More misses than hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Mike and Ed sit before a stern Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike teaches Alex the cross over dribble. Scarlet brings boys water. Mike checks her out as she goes back in the house. Alex bounces the ball off his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muffled buzz. Mike reaches into his pocket, pulls out h phone. A PIX MESSAGE. Mike opens it. A close up of perfec CLEAVAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike peeks over his shoulder...the Wonder Bras text on th phones. He's confused until-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Mike turns a little more in his seat...MAGGIE smiles seductively at him, blows a kiss. Mike GASPS, spins back around...TRAUMATIZED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet fills holes with plants then waters them with a h She turns, finds Mike SLEEPING in the grass. Scarlet pick up the hose, TURNS IT ON HIM. Mike leaps up, chases her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Alex, Nicole, Maggie, the Bras and a slew of KIDS h by Mike's Aston. Stan, Jazz and Kevin are all that's left Stan's Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex scampers through the maze of cones, dribbling from h to hand...and does it perfectly. Mike and Alex high 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scarlet lug an ornate, wooden bench to it's spot They sit. Mike casually places a hand on Scarlet's leg. Scarlet casually removes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A game of 1 on 1. Alex dribbles up to Mike. Mike crouches in a defensive stance. Mike goes for the ball. Alex cross over. Mike misses. Alex pulls up, shoots and scores. Mike smiles, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Mike and Ed sit before Julie. She hands Ed a slip paper...3 detentions. Ed chokes back crocodile tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike places books in his locker, shuts the door revealing goo goo eyed Maggie. Mike startles and RUNS. Maggie chase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stands behind the 3 point line. Mike rapidly feeds h balls. Alex catches, shoots and moves. This time...they'r all going in. Mike passes the last ball. Alex shoots and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a ball going through the hoop. Wider reveals Ale following through. He and Mike tap fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's TRY-OUTS. Coach Harvey, a number of HOPEFULS, Maggie Nicole and the Bras watch the game of half court, 2 on 2. Stan and Jazz vs. Mike and Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Alex school Stan and Jazz. Steals, picks, fancy passes and scoring. The Coach watches with awe. A final 3 pointer by Mike in Stan's face seals the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes 11-3. Game over. Gather up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex passes Harvey, Harvey stops him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta little bit of your old man in you, O'Donnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Team and the Hopefuls huddle around Coach Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you all know due to the amount of seniors coming back I only have 2 open spots on the roster. It's Freedman and O'Donnell. The rest of you hit the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hopefuls trudge out of the gym.    Alex leaps into th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooo!   We did it, Mark!    We did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed it out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex runs over, hugs Nicole. Mike beams with pride.     C Harvey puts an arm around him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, I don't know where you came from but you just made my year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex rushes through the door.   Mike and Maggie follow. Maggie slaps Mike's butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!    Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARLET (o.s.) I'll be right out, Honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got'a use the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE follow Mike down the hall. As he passes a half open do he pauses, peeks in...Scarlet, facing away, pulls a shirt over her nude back, shakes out her long hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike watches...no, he GAZES longingly, lovingly...lost in beauty until...Scarlet turns, startles-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark? I didn't know you were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     You just look so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet blushes...it's been a while since she's heard tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I zip you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wearing a sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your jeans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet walks towards him and...SLAM...shuts the door on Mike wanders to the bathroom, shaking his head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid, idiot, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters, steps over to the toilet. Maggie slips in be him, shuts the door. He whirls around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie places a finger on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. I get it now. Why you didn't want me to be with Stan, the nice things you said in the library. It's because you wanted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie backs Mike against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, listen to me.    I'm not the person you think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Yes, you are. You're a good guy. You're not like the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! I'm not like the others. I'm very different than the others. So different that you and I can never be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie stops, looks quizzically at Mike-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say?    Are you..."confused"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! That's it. I'm confused. Extremely confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmygod! It all makes sense now! Your hair. The highlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike starts to speak.   Stops.   Finally gets it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No-no-no-no. I'm not gay. I'm...I've been in love with the same girl since I was 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie switches back into predatory mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Does she go to our school? Do I know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't. Now- (eyes the toilet) -if you don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your girlfriend she better keep a close eye on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie smiles seductively and struts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex types on his phone.   Mike enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you texting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad.   I have to tell him about today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods...then realizes...BEEP...BEEP. HIS PHONE.     A and Maggie look to Mike. Mike checks his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just get a text?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I'm not in the mood for games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no game. I'm me...him...Mike. It's me...your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet winces as if dealt a blow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why would you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth. I'm the father of your children. You have to believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever come near me or my family again. If you do, I'll have you arrested or better yet, institutionalized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet marches towards the house.    Mike on her heels pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain, Scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she passes Ed and Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son needs a shrink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet storms off.   Before Mike can protest-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pervert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns. SLAP. Maggie lights him up, runs for the hous SLAP, SLAP, SLAP. The Bras add theirs on the way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nicole march past.    Mike reaches for Alex's ar Alex pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, wait. Let me explain-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex whisks Nicole into the house.   Mike lowers his head stomps over, grabs Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is a disaster! A kid pissed all over my English garden! What were you thinking!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hates me, Ed.    I've ruined everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike runs for the house.   Julie looks quizzically to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who hates him? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed shifts uncomfortably, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy. I don't quite know how to put this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try being honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not really my son.    I don't have a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAP.   Ed looks like he's about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's obviously having a crisis and you...you insensitive bastard, you disown him? He'd be better off with his mother in Thailand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie strides for the house.     Ed yells after her-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I call you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is normal.   No signs of a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed knocks and knocks on Mike's bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   It's been 2 days.    Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE hear a dragging sound then...CLICK.     Ed turns the k opens the door, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.   Mike climbs back into bed.   Ed waves at the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. It smells like Jeffrey Dahmer's kitchen in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed pulls up the blinds, opens the windows. A disheveled, Mike groans, rolls away from the light. Ed sits on the be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really messed up.    I've lost my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.      Nothing's ever truly lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you and Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that?    That's lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the party.      I'll pay for any damages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. My spa guy got the last of the vomit out of the pool so we're good. I don't mean to rub salt in your wounds but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed holds up the manila envelope of divorce papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you're due in court in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of determination comes over Mike's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW roars out of the garage, Ed driving, tears down t driveway, fishtailing onto the street, LOSES CONTROL, rip across a neighbor's lawn then back onto the road and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded pews. Scarlet stands before the JUDGE, her right hand raised as she's sworn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -the whole truth and nothing but the truth so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet sits beside her ATTORNEY.     The Judge eyes her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've requested a divorce by the State of California citing irreconcilable differences. Is this correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Michael O'Donnell or his representative present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SADLY) No, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I take his absence as agreement to the orders of the divorce. Let's proceed. You're not asking for alimony or child support?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's BMW skids to a stop in front of the building.   Mike Ed bound out, race up the court steps-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We just need to stop her from going through with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well thought out plan.   Good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother will have full custody of the children. The father will have visitation rights of one weekend a month-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. The doors burst open.   All turn to see Mike and Ed storm down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I declare a mistrial on the grounds of insufficient evidence and Sacco and Vanzetti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet can only shake her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacco and...what are you....who are you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am legal counsel for Mike O'Donnell and I demand a stay of execution for this marriage, your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my husband's best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a lawyer, best friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No but I have been a defendant in numerous lawsuits so-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bailiff! Get these 2 out of my courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff grabs Mike and a yelling Ed, drags them towar the exit. Mike wiggles free, runs back to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor! I have a letter from Mike O'Donnell. Just let me read it. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's okay, your Honor.   I'd like to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike digs into his pocket, pulls out a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your Honor. (READS) September 7th, 1988 was the first time I saw you. You were reading `The Great Gatsby' and wearing a Guns N Roses T-shirt. I'd never seen anything so perfect. I remember thinking I had to have you or I'd die...not in a psycho kinda way but in that beautiful, innocent, unaffected way that way only a 17 year-old kid can have. You whispered you loved me at the homecoming dance and I felt so peaceful and safe because I knew no matter what happened from that night on nothing could ever be that bad because I had you. And then I grew up, lost my way and blamed you for my failures. But I was never lost. I'd just forgotten the way life makes you forget as you grow older. And I never failed at anything because on that September day you said `yes' to me. And at that dance you said you loved me. And as I stand here...as I write this, I want you to know if I don't have you I'll die...not in a psycho way but in that beautiful, innocent, unaffected way only a 17 year old kid can have....oh and...P.S...I'm `Hungry Like the Wolf'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike places the PAPER ON THE TABLE, looks over to Scarlet Scarlet just stares at him, tears streaming down her cheeks...sadness...recognition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, son, you have to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods, walks down the aisle and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, Sir. I'm sorry.   I'm in no shape...I need to postpone...I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tearful Scarlet starts to leave, stops, picks up Mike's `letter'...DIRECTIONS TO THE COURTHOUSE. She looks back confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solemn Mike stares out the window.    Ed turns the radi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it wasn't a spell of enlightenment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the website once you've learned your lesson you'd turn back. That speech should've broken the spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough with the magic crap, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what this means? You need to let them go. You need to let them get on with their lives and you need to get on with yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike chokes back tears...because he knows Ed is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike works on his laptop, plugs his iPhone into it...downloads pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike moves to the bed, packs his Falcons uniform into a duffel bag. A BEEP. Mike unplugs the iPhone, types an ema to Scarlet, "I think this will help your business. Best o luck, Mark" Mike hits send, grabs his bag and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps outside, throws his duffel into the Aston. exits the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving on. See you at the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike climbs into the car, pulls out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet sits at the kitchen table working on her laptop. noise of an incoming email. She clicks over...MARK FREEDM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet reads Mike's email then clicks on the link. A web site pops up...`Scarlet's Sanctuaries'. Scarlet smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty gym. Mike stands feet beyond the 3 point line, grabs balls from a hopper and rapidly shoots, shoots, sho SWISH...SWISH...SWISH. Automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Harvey enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Freedman, save some for the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sinks one last jumper, turns to the coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just warming up, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Harvey hands Mike a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, I haven't seen anyone with your shooting ability in, well, in a long time. I called a couple college scouts I know. They're coming to the game tonight...to watch you. If you have half the season I think you're capable of, you can play anywhere you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the Falcons basketball team jogs out from the locker room followed by a PHOTOGRAPHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round up, Jock Straps! Picture time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Team assembles in the middle of the court. Alex moves away from Mike. A PLAYER kneeling in front holds a sign,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH.   And with the flash WE cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POPULAR SONG rocks the gymnasium. CHEERLEADERS dance on the sidelines. STUDENTS and PARENTS cheer wildly from the packed stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie gabs with a group of TEACHERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one end of the court, the Falcons run a pass and shoot drill. On the opposite end, a TEAM in BLUE shoots around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sees Scarlet and Maggie enter. He smiles apologetica to them. Both turn away, climb the bleachers, join Nicole and the Wonder Bras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scarlet) I thought he was hanging out with Alex to get to me- not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE...Coach Harvey claps loudly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Ladies, bring it in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Falcons swarm the bench, take their seats. Mike takes deep breath, sits next to Alex. Alex looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never meant to hurt you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you kiss my mom!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, I'm your fa...I don't know. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stands-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky I don't punch you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex moves down the line, takes another seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed strides through the door spots Julie, makes his way ov to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, can I talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie excuses herself from the Teachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen a good friend of mine lose everything that means anything to him. And maybe we'll never be there but...I just really want to play D & D with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie can't help but smile, sizes Ed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can raid my dungeon anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring my long bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REFEREE blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Remember, Boys, winners get the girls. Losers please themselves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and the Falcons jog onto the court. Mike takes his place for the jump ball. The Crowd stomps, cheers LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks around the gymnasium...it almost seems to SLOW UP...the sound deafening. He finds Alex on the bench...hi hopeful face. Mike looks into the stands...Maggie and Scarlet. Scarlet abruptly stands, climbs back down the bleachers and exits the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ref readies to toss the ball.    Mike takes a deep breath...and walks off the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son! Come back here!      You're gonna get a delay of game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps over to Alex-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your turn now.    Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rushes off the court. As Mike disappears into the tunnel, WE see the OLD JANITOR amongst the crowd. He smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Harvey turns to Alex-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off your butt, O'Donnell!    Get in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex leaps off the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel is EMPTY.    Crestfallen, Mike lowers his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Scarlet as she appears at the far end of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Mike and he's 36 years-old again, bursting out his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best choice I ever made was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlet and Mike walk towards one another, picking up the pace the closer they get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happ-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike wraps his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lock lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes Scarlet's hand and as they walk out of the tun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's best if we don't tell the kids about this. Especially Maggie.
